intro: Siler siler, commonly known as narrowleaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. Its slender, upright stems are often adorned with small, lance-shaped leaves. Siler siler produces clusters of pale purple to pink flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators.
